boardgame.name: Het achtste Wereldwonder
Tower of Babel
Der Turmbau zu Babel
boardgame.description: Together, the players use cards to try to build the eight wonders of the ancient world. The number they build varies, but can't be more than seven. (Hence the subtitle of the game, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;...or why the eighth wonder was never built._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;) While building together, each tries to provide the majority of the components for each wonder and collect scoring disks (in four suits). When it's someone else turn, you offer cards to the active player, and by good offers, can earn points (or sometimes even the disk). So a feature of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Tower of Babel_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; is that players always perform actions and can earn points during another's turn. Card trade offers, collecting disk sets, and building wonders are the three ways to earn victory points. The game ends when a player takes the last disk of any one of the four suits, so players have some influence on the game's end moment. And, the victory points determine the winner at game end. Typical game length is less than an hour._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Reiner Knizia Variant--some recommend against using the action cards because the publisher rather than Reiner Knizia added them and because they damage the game balance. To play with this variant, simply leave the action cards in the box. There is no bonus to the person who completes the final stage of a wonder._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2005 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Advanced Game Nominee

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: never played +++++ german version, but game conponents are language independent and you can download translations from boardgamegeek +++++ will be shipped insured +++++ payment for usa, canada, asia or australia : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for other non-euro-countries : cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have euro : cash (by letter) or bank transfer (wich by the way is cost-free !) +++++ payment for germany : personal pick up in berlin or bank transfer +++++ foreign buyers beware : german postal sadly is very expensive for foreign packages (about 18 - 45 euros, it depends on, where the package has to be shipped and the weight), pleask at for shipping prices, before you buy !) +++++ shipping inside germany will cost 8 euros, including insurance

Rio Grande Games (RIO 268) Number of players: 3-5 Age of players: 12+ Length: 75 minutes Game Description: Together, the players build the eight wonders of the ancient world. While building together, each tries to provide the majority of the components for each wonder and collect scoring tiles. Together, these things earn the players victory points. And, the victory points determine the winner at game end. Author: Reiner Knizia

Tower of Babel, new in shrink. --- Georgia sales tax applies to customers with delivery addresses within the state. The amount is determined by the delivery location. For our customers in Atlanta: - You may pay in person with cash or credit card, or online with a credit card via WePay - You may pick up your purchase at no extra charge, either at one of our weekly gaming meetups (gameswellplayed.com/meetups) or at our home in Candler Park - For $3.00 we will deliver your entire order to any location inside or near the Perimeter Shipping options outside Atlanta: - You may pay online with a credit card via WePay - For $11.30 we will ship your game USPS Priority Mail. This is a flat rate and we will add other items to your shipment at no additional cost when possible
